intro: Scabiosa columbaria f. pilosa, commonly known as the woolly scabious, is a flowering plant characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its unique fuzzy texture and delicate blooms make it a distinctive addition to gardens and natural habitats. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological benefits to pollinators.
